noun.description: A question, especially one addressed to an official or organization.
examples: a spokeswoman said queries could not be answered until Monday

verb.description: Ask a question about something, especially in order to express one's doubts about it or to check its validity or accuracy.
examples: many people queried whether any harm had been done

origin: Mid 17th century: anglicized form of the Latin imperative quaere!, used in the 16th century in English as a verb in the sense inquire and as a noun meaning query, from Latin quaerere ask, seek.
